Name: Elder Priestess Ysolde Tharn
Backstory: Once a traveling oracle, Ysolde settled in Karnstadt after a vision led her to the ruins of the chapel. She rebuilt its altar with her own hands and now leads nightly rites in reverence of Edras, god of dusk and memory. Her voice trembles with power, and she is rumored to receive true visions in her sleep.

Name: Novice Callen
Backstory: Callen was a stable boy before he was taken in by Ysolde after a fever dream drove him to the chapel gates. Quiet and diligent, he cares for the herb garden and knows every grave in the cemetery by heart.

Name: Novice Thalia Merren
Backstory: Daughter of a merchant who fled after a scandal, Thalia took refuge in the chapel. She struggles with faith but is fiercely loyal to Ysolde and often sneaks into the cemetery to speak with the dead.

Name: Brother Edran
Backstory: A retired soldier who lost his sight in battle, Edran now listens to the chapel bells daily. He helps maintain the grounds and is known for telling long stories to anyone who will sit with him by the graves.

Name: Widow Maelen
Backstory: Maelen has lit a candle every night for her husband for the past 30 years. She brings offerings of bread and herbs, and is often found weeping softly during the rites.

Name: Little Dorrie
Backstory: A mute orphan girl who appeared one winter and never left. She helps tend to candles and rituals in complete silence, her eyes reflecting wisdom far beyond her years.
